info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 10 at 4:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Moderate to heavy snow showers and gusty winds will impact portions of southeastern Lewis and Clark, Meagher and northeastern Gallatin Counties through 430 PM MST... At 356 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking moderate to heavy snow showers along a line extending from 26 miles southeast of Cascade to 12 miles west of White Sulphur Springs to near Three Forks. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Moderate to heavy snow, wind gusts up to 40 mph, and visibility as low as a half mile or less. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hazardous travel due to significantly reduced visibility and slippery roads. Locations impacted include... White Sulphur Springs, Three Forks, Manhattan, Toston, Fort Logan On The Smith River, Ringling, Fort Logan, Missouri Headwaters State Park, Newlan Creek Reservoir, Logan, Maudlow, Lennep, Trident and Menard. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
